column4: Good morning... anyone here know why 6.06LTS-x86_64 isn't seeing both cores on an Athlon 3800x2?
2.6.15-23-amd64-generic #1 SMP PREEMPT Tue May 23 13:45:47 UTC 2006 x86_64 GNU/Linux
I'm looking at /proc/cpuinfo, I don't have graphic access to the machine yet.
I _suppose_ i can start a remote X session. :)
but I'm sitting on the end of a dialup connection at the moment.
I can go grab clean kernel source and build from scratch, that's not a problem to do, but if there's an easy ubuntu-esque fix i'd rather do that.
model name      : AMD Athlon(tm) 64 X2 Dual Core Processor 3800+
I think there is a mistake cos I have a similar cpu and I auto detected the two cores on the 64bit install also
hmmm ok. I can deal with it, doesn't mean i like it :-)
Well when I uname -a it says SMP #1 too, but when I look graphically it shows two cores!
tres weird, I've never seen /proc/cpuinfo report the wrong information before.
On my Fedora machine, I installed Core 6 and it set my Pentium D 820 as i586 single core.. ..  ..  joke
What's the kernel source package name for 6.06 LTS?
uname to get the kernel and is it .src at the end to get?
